column4: Hi, could anyone help to troubleshoot why my Ubuntu 9.04 automatically reboots 9 times of 10 during the Boot-Up? And quite oftenly freezes.
can you boot from the cd and run memtest and see if its bad ram
I did the memtest, it finished without errors.
how far does it get in the boot before it reboots?
right after I choose the OS from Grub loader
do you have windows installed and does it boot?
ok ... can you boot an older kernel?
nop the same applies to older kernels. Where to diagnose Hard Disk errors?
might want to look into ultimate boot cd to test the drive
actually I am thinking that this might be a Hardware error. Right now It booted! I bet that after 10minutes it will freeze again. Where to look for bootup error logs?
Ok, this line looks suspicious gdmgreeter[3020]: segfault at 13a ip 00007fadf3bfbaa3
I used to see similiar errors when I was using a drive that was dying
that Ultimate Boot CD will verify this?
ok thanks, I will try it out
